ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Exception when instantiating Processor (when launching crawl job with a custom processor)
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t know what s happening, but parts of your description don t add up. In particular, all the concrete Processor classes standard with Heritrix have

 launching crawl job with a custom processor)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=N5RSeP9vNKvLy82HTuf-I3zIxRry7DZggZ_ZInRjI0tQ
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

I don't know what's happening, but parts of your description don't add up.

In particular, all the concrete Processor classes standard with Heritrix 
have no-argument constructors, and don't trigger any problem. Indeed, a 
Processor class needs to have a no-argument constructor to be instantiable.

So, removing such a constructor would also mean no instance of that 
Processor is part of the launched configuration.

Perhaps your custom Processor has settings Key<>s, but does not register 
them with the settings system via the KeyManager.addKeys() 
static-initializer code you'll see at the bottom of other configurable 
classes?

- Gordon @ IA

>>> Not sure if this is going to help you, but i was getting a similar error
>>> when trying to debug in eclipse, and i jsut laoded all the binary 2rd party
>>> lib jars on the runtime classpath and then i could use the webui fine.
>>>
>>> I was having this error happen to me when i tried to edit a global Sheet
>>> config.
>>>

>>>>
>>>> This happens even if the constructor code is totally empty. If I
>>>> remove the constructor everything works. However having a constructor
>>>> to perform initialization would be nice...
>>>>
>>>> Am I doing something wrong? Any help appreciated.
